headline: S&P Global: Buy The Overblown Sell-Off (Rating Upgrade)
summary: S&P Global (SPGI) upgraded to Buy after sell-off: strong Q3 FY25 margins, guidance raised, Mobility spin-off & rate-cut/AI tailwinds. See more here.

headline: S&P Global Reshapes Portfolio With Mobility Spin Off And New Insights
summary: S&P Global plans to separate its Mobility business into an independent public company called Mobility Global, Inc. The spin off will create a focused vehicle lifecycle intelligence company distinct from S&P Global's core operations. The company also launched the Partner Perspectives thought leadership initiative with leading institutions. Partner Perspectives is intended to broaden market dialogue and analysis across key sectors and themes. S&P Global (NYSE:SPGI), trading at $465.51, is...

headline: S&P Global Launches New Partner Perspectives Initiative, Debuts Collaborative Research Volume with Vanguard
summary: S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI) today announced the launch of Partner Perspectives, a new thought-leadership initiative that convenes leading institutions to examine the trends shaping global markets.

headline: Down 13.4% in 4 Weeks, Here's Why You Should You Buy the Dip in S&P Global (SPGI)
summary: S&P Global (SPGI) is technically in oversold territory now, so the heavy selling pressure might have exhausted. This along with strong agreement among Wall Street analysts in raising earnings estimates could lead to a trend reversal for the stock.

headline: What NJ chains were hit by bankruptcies in the past few years?
summary: Data by the Wall Street rating agency S&P Global showed that there were 785 bankruptcies in 2025 — the third consecutive year that the number rose.
